column5: Some nice bass Brian & Terry! It's such a sad sight to see all those floating carp...
Great to see two of my favourite board members on the water once again.  Best to Brian and Terry.  I have other favourite board members too.

Not touching a rod since last November,it was time to get out and get back into the swing of things. So after yesturday and seeing all the boats and fish,I was ready to hit the waters again. I met up with my bud Terry at the river and it was a great calm morning.    During our trip down the river,there was a stinch in the air. Hundreds of dead carp floating all along the banks. It was,a very sadding sight. Im not a carp fisher,but I can just amagine what this kind of site would mean to one.At first we thought it would be a waste of time fishing for them buckets with this kill happening,but we gave it a go anyways. Tought conditions to say the lease. Trying to pitch in good spots and there would be a dead carcuss in the same area. Decided to try a run further down the river,maybe the dead carp would be less. Sure enough we found a few good stretches where the carp die off was limited and we,well Terry started to get into them.     The forcasted rain that was to start around 9 am did not really appear,but we did get a bit of a drizzel,then Terry got another.    I believe the score at the end of the day was Terry 8,myself 3.He put the smack down on them. I told Terry I was fishing for quality,you know,those 5 good bites. Cant be playing with thos small fish. LOL Baits used today were craw tubes on jigs and beaver tails and  bucket slammers.   Terry has the rest of the phots as I knew my cam was crap,so we used his most of the time.Plus his makes my fish look bigger. HAHAHAHA  Thanks pal for the time today. Lets do it again real soon.Hope yer arm is ok for work Monday. It,s a beatch getting old aint it.LOL  Later bud
The Dynamic Duo!
nice  i've never flipped for bass  looks prodcutive

Hey Brian Had a great time, but really didn't like all the dead carp we had to cast around, I am sure many bass moved out of the river because of it. a few more hot days and it is going to stink something nasty.. keep the dust off the reels and lets do it again soon
Yer cam takes great pic,s,but what happen to that 5 pounder I caught,you playing with photoshop again.LOL Sorry about the dust in yer boat. We,ll have to head out for smallies to even the score.
Hey Bri, you didn't stand a chance relegated to the back of the boat! Have you considered getting a bass boat? It's great to see you guys getting out again! -Brian

When we were in the 19 footer, I had a chance. He couldnt cover everything,but when yer in a 16 footer,well,I get the endtrails sorta speak. Terry left me the back spots. I like the ones deep in there,he takes the front spots.(That didnt sound right I know   ) No worries,smallies will be his down fall.HAHAHAHA Im still smile,n about gett,n out. I just need to get my brake line that busted on the way home fixed in the morn. Glad it happen close to home,not on the hwy.
hey   hey  hey  I kept offering him the front of the boat...   I needed a rest   no, not from catching fish but, from steering the boat
Yes he did,but,I thought I might fall off the seat,or the seat was booby trapped. HA
so, you do know why I wanted you up front  now I have to reweild my seat

A little rusty I suspect but it looks like you remembered something after all the time and a little help from Terry I'm sure....  .  lots of Carp around there I bet....Flippin!.....  At least you pulled out some of the Green ones

GB RUSTY yes,but it came back.Terry showed me ,and I am very grateful he did. It,s a blast. You might want to try it.LOL You would not believe the amount of dead carp. There were ones even on the last breath. I never seen such a thing. UNREAL.
oh, I found the picture of the big bass........lol
Nice looking fish guys, sounds like a fun day flipping.  Sucks to here about the carp again though
Wow! You guys did awwwwright!! Really like that pic of you with the weedline behind you, must be a good camera.
hey, where do you get those OFC hats?  and what type of adjuster is on the back?
one like this
Great report and pics y'all!!!
Great report and pics. I hate fishing out of the back, unless I get one that the guy in front missed

Great report B.  You have no idea how happy it makes me to see you out there fishing again  Some beauty buckets there, although I'm skeptical about the last pic Terry posted  That's really a shame about the carp.  I sure hope they figure out the problem and fix it.  Joey
Nice report! This post has got me jonsing to do some flippin. Thanks for sharing.
Saw a lot of guys out on Little lake flipping the lily pads without much luck at all on Sat.  Looks like you guys were doing something right!!!!  Great report!
Great report guys and Congrats on the fish.  Mike
Dynamic duo indeed......  the first time out is always a blast!!!
